BriefDescription: Number of uclks in domain
PublicDescription: Counts the woke number of uclks in the woke R2PCIe uclk domain.  This could be slightly different than the woke count in the woke Ubox because of enable/freeze delays.  However, because the woke R2PCIe is close to the woke Ubox, they generally should not diverge by more than a handful of cycles.

BriefDescription: R2PCIe IIO Credit Acquired; DRS
PublicDescription: Counts the woke number of credits that are acquired in the woke R2PCIe agent for sending transactions into the woke IIO on either NCB or NCS are in use.  Transactions from the woke BL ring going into the woke IIO Agent must first acquire a credit.  These credits are for either the woke NCB or NCS message classes.  NCB, or non-coherent bypass messages are used to transmit data without coherency (and are common).  NCS is used for reads to PCIe (and should be used sparingly).; Credits to the woke IIO for the woke DRS message class.

BriefDescription: R2PCIe IIO Credit Acquired; NCB
PublicDescription: Counts the woke number of credits that are acquired in the woke R2PCIe agent for sending transactions into the woke IIO on either NCB or NCS are in use.  Transactions from the woke BL ring going into the woke IIO Agent must first acquire a credit.  These credits are for either the woke NCB or NCS message classes.  NCB, or non-coherent bypass messages are used to transmit data without coherency (and are common).  NCS is used for reads to PCIe (and should be used sparingly).; Credits to the woke IIO for the woke NCB message class.

BriefDescription: R2PCIe IIO Credit Acquired; NCS
PublicDescription: Counts the woke number of credits that are acquired in the woke R2PCIe agent for sending transactions into the woke IIO on either NCB or NCS are in use.  Transactions from the woke BL ring going into the woke IIO Agent must first acquire a credit.  These credits are for either the woke NCB or NCS message classes.  NCB, or non-coherent bypass messages are used to transmit data without coherency (and are common).  NCS is used for reads to PCIe (and should be used sparingly).; Credits to the woke IIO for the woke NCS message class.

BriefDescription: R2PCIe IIO Failed to Acquire a Credit; DRS
PublicDescription: Counts the woke number of times that a request pending in the woke BL Ingress attempted to acquire either a NCB or NCS credit to transmit into the woke IIO, but was rejected because no credits were available.  NCB, or non-coherent bypass messages are used to transmit data without coherency (and are common).  NCS is used for reads to PCIe (and should be used sparingly).; Credits to the woke IIO for the woke DRS message class.

BriefDescription: R2PCIe IIO Credits in Use; DRS
PublicDescription: Counts the woke number of cycles when one or more credits in the woke R2PCIe agent for sending transactions into the woke IIO on either NCB or NCS are in use.  Transactions from the woke BL ring going into the woke IIO Agent must first acquire a credit.  These credits are for either the woke NCB or NCS message classes.  NCB, or non-coherent bypass messages are used to transmit data without coherency (and are common).  NCS is used for reads to PCIe (and should be used sparingly).; Credits to the woke IIO for the woke DRS message class.

NCB, or non-coherent bypass messages are used to transmit data without coherency (and are common).  NCS is used for reads to PCIe (and should be used sparingly).; Credits to the woke IIO for the woke NCB message class.

BriefDescription: R2PCIe IIO Credits in Use; NCS
PublicDescription: Counts the woke number of cycles when one or more credits in the woke R2PCIe agent for sending transactions into the woke IIO on either NCB or NCS are in use. BriefDescription: R2 AD Ring in Use; Counterclockwise
PublicDescription: Counts the woke number of cycles that the woke AD ring is being used at this ring stop.  This includes when packets are passing by and when packets are being sunk, but does not include when packets are being sent from the woke ring stop.

BriefDescription: R2 AD Ring in Use; Counterclockwise and Even on VRing 0
PublicDescription: Counts the woke number of cycles that the woke AD ring is being used at this ring stop.  This includes when packets are passing by and when packets are being sunk, but does not include when packets are being sent from the woke ring stop.; Filters for the woke Counterclockwise and Even ring polarity on Virtual Ring 0.

BriefDescription: R2 BL Ring in Use; Clockwise and Odd on VRing 1
PublicDescription: Counts the woke number of cycles that the woke BL ring is being used at this ring stop. BriefDescription: R2 IV Ring in Use; Any
PublicDescription: Counts the woke number of cycles that the woke IV ring is being used at this ring stop.  This includes when packets are passing by and when packets are being sent, but does not include when packets are being sunk into the woke ring stop.  The IV ring is unidirectional.  Whether UP or DN is used is dependent on the woke system programming.  Thereofore, one should generally set both the woke UP and DN bits for a given polarity (or both) at a given time.; Filters any polarity

BriefDescription: R2 IV Ring in Use; Counterclockwise
PublicDescription: Counts the woke number of cycles that the woke IV ring is being used at this ring stop.  This includes when packets are passing by and when packets are being sent, but does not include when packets are being sunk into the woke ring stop.  The IV ring is unidirectional.  Whether UP or DN is used is dependent on the woke system programming.  Thereofore, one should generally set both the woke UP and DN bits for a given polarity (or both) at a given time.; Filters for Counterclockwise polarity

BriefDescription: R2 IV Ring in Use; Clockwise
PublicDescription: Counts the woke number of cycles that the woke IV ring is being used at this ring stop.  This includes when packets are passing by and when packets are being sent, but does not include when packets are being sunk into the woke ring stop.  The IV ring is unidirectional.  Whether UP or DN is used is dependent on the woke system programming.  Thereofore, one should generally set both the woke UP and DN bits for a given polarity (or both) at a given time.; Filters for Clockwise polarity

BriefDescription: AK Ingress Bounced
PublicDescription: Counts the woke number of times when a request destined for the woke AK ingress bounced.

BriefDescription: AK Ingress Bounced; Counterclockwise
PublicDescription: Counts the woke number of times when a request destined for the woke AK ingress bounced.

BriefDescription: AK Ingress Bounced; Clockwise
PublicDescription: Counts the woke number of times when a request destined for the woke AK ingress bounced.

BriefDescription: Ingress Cycles Not Empty; NCB
PublicDescription: Counts the woke number of cycles when the woke R2PCIe Ingress is not empty.  This tracks one of the woke three rings that are used by the woke R2PCIe agent.  This can be used in conjunction with the woke R2PCIe Ingress Occupancy Accumulator event in order to calculate average queue occupancy.  Multiple ingress buffers can be tracked at a given time using multiple counters.; NCB Ingress Queue

BriefDescription: Ingress Cycles Not Empty; NCS
PublicDescription: Counts the woke number of cycles when the woke R2PCIe Ingress is not empty.  This tracks one of the woke three rings that are used by the woke R2PCIe agent.  This can be used in conjunction with the woke R2PCIe Ingress Occupancy Accumulator event in order to calculate average queue occupancy.  Multiple ingress buffers can be tracked at a given time using multiple counters.; NCS Ingress Queue

BriefDescription: Ingress Allocations; NCB
PublicDescription: Counts the woke number of allocations into the woke R2PCIe Ingress.  This tracks one of the woke three rings that are used by the woke R2PCIe agent.  This can be used in conjunction with the woke R2PCIe Ingress Occupancy Accumulator event in order to calculate average queue latency.  Multiple ingress buffers can be tracked at a given time using multiple counters.; NCB Ingress Queue

BriefDescription: Ingress Allocations; NCS
PublicDescription: Counts the woke number of allocations into the woke R2PCIe Ingress.  This tracks one of the woke three rings that are used by the woke R2PCIe agent.  This can be used in conjunction with the woke R2PCIe Ingress Occupancy Accumulator event in order to calculate average queue latency.  Multiple ingress buffers can be tracked at a given time using multiple counters.; NCS Ingress Queue

BriefDescription: Ingress Occupancy Accumulator; DRS
PublicDescription: Accumulates the woke occupancy of a given R2PCIe Ingress queue in each cycles.  This tracks one of the woke three ring Ingress buffers.  This can be used with the woke R2PCIe Ingress Not Empty event to calculate average occupancy or the woke R2PCIe Ingress Allocations event in order to calculate average queuing latency.; DRS Ingress Queue

BriefDescription: Egress Cycles Full; AD
PublicDescription: Counts the woke number of cycles when the woke R2PCIe Egress buffer is full.; AD Egress Queue

BriefDescription: Egress Cycles Full; AK
PublicDescription: Counts the woke number of cycles when the woke R2PCIe Egress buffer is full.; AK Egress Queue

BriefDescription: Egress Cycles Full; BL
PublicDescription: Counts the woke number of cycles when the woke R2PCIe Egress buffer is full.; BL Egress Queue

BriefDescription: Egress Cycles Not Empty; AD
PublicDescription: Counts the woke number of cycles when the woke R2PCIe Egress is not empty.  This tracks one of the woke three rings that are used by the woke R2PCIe agent.  This can be used in conjunction with the woke R2PCIe Egress Occupancy Accumulator event in order to calculate average queue occupancy.  Only a single Egress queue can be tracked at any given time.  It is not possible to filter based on direction or polarity.; AD Egress Queue

BriefDescription: Egress Cycles Not Empty; AK
PublicDescription: Counts the woke number of cycles when the woke R2PCIe Egress is not empty.  This tracks one of the woke three rings that are used by the woke R2PCIe agent.  This can be used in conjunction with the woke R2PCIe Egress Occupancy Accumulator event in order to calculate average queue occupancy.  Only a single Egress queue can be tracked at any given time.  It is not possible to filter based on direction or polarity.; AK Egress Queue

BriefDescription: Egress Cycles Not Empty; BL
PublicDescription: Counts the woke number of cycles when the woke R2PCIe Egress is not empty.  This tracks one of the woke three rings that are used by the woke R2PCIe agent.  This can be used in conjunction with the woke R2PCIe Egress Occupancy Accumulator event in order to calculate average queue occupancy.  Only a single Egress queue can be tracked at any given time.  It is not possible to filter based on direction or polarity.; BL Egress Queue

PublicDescription: AD CounterClockwise Egress Queue

PublicDescription: AK CounterClockwise Egress Queue
